net.cwroethel.swt.popupcalendar
Class MonthSelectorStyle

java.lang.Object
  net.cwroethel.swt.popupcalendar.DateChooserStyle
      net.cwroethel.swt.popupcalendar.MonthSelectorStyle
Direct Known Subclasses:
MonthSelectorStyleAdapter
public class MonthSelectorStyle
extends DateChooserStyle

Class containing the style information to be used for drawing the month selector. This class is meant to be inherited to define custom styles. The preferred way to do that is to inherit constructors and all methods from this class and just implement the overrideStyle() class. This allows the definition of personal settings without having to deal with the internals of the style class. For additional conveniance a MonthSelectorStyleAdapter is provided.

Version:
$Revision: 1.2 $
Author:
Will Roethel, http://www.cwroethel.net

Overrides:
setDefaultStyle in class DateChooserStyle

getMonthName

public java.lang.String getMonthName(int month)
Get the name of a month for a given index. The index corresponds to the values of java.util.Calendar.MONTH, i.e. January == 0.

Parameters:
month - int
Returns:
String

setMonthNames

public void setMonthNames(java.lang.String[] months)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
Override the default weekday names with a new set. The array must be of length 12 otherwise an exception with be thrown. The matching of month names with index values follows the convention in java.util.Calendar with January having index 0.

Parameters:
months - String[]
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
